school_name: New York City College of Technology
tag_professor: Respected (2)  Hilarious (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)  Caring (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  Amazing lectures (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)
stu_tags: LECTURE HEAVY  TEST HEAVY  SKIP CLASS? YOU WON\'T PASS.
comments: He is a great professor, despite the coursework which can be a bit heavy and boring. If you dont have the greatest studying habits and cant follow powerpoint lectures then his class isnt for you. Other than that solid professor, enjoyable class.

school_name: New York City College of Technology
tag_professor: Respected (2)  Hilarious (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)  Caring (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  Amazing lectures (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)
stu_tags: CLEAR GRADING CRITERIA  CARING  GIVES GOOD FEEDBACK
comments: The professor is a great person and asks students if they have any questions to reduce confusion. The course overall is difficult because a lot of information is thrown at you and students can be easily confused and lost. The professor gives a review before the exam but sometimes the questions on the exam are more confusing than the review sheet.

school_name: New York City College of Technology
tag_professor: Respected (2)  Hilarious (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)  Caring (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  Amazing lectures (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)
comments: I have never rated a professor before but im rating professor Scanlon because hes THE BEST one ive ever had. 2 exams ,drops the lowest, and a final. Gives review sheet first day of class with every question that will be on all his exams. He doesnt care about attendance but dont miss to much if you want to understand. U will not regret taking him

school_name: New York City College of Technology
tag_professor: Respected (2)  Hilarious (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)  Caring (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  Amazing lectures (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)
comments: Great Professor!!!!! If you pay attention in class, you will pass. The attendance is not part of the grade but if you miss 10% of the overall attendance, you will fail. I never even opened the textbook because his slides were already informative enough. He always made jokes and made the class fun. Take him, you won\'t regret it.

school_name: New York City College of Technology
tag_professor: Respected (2)  Hilarious (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)  Caring (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  Amazing lectures (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)
comments: He is a really easy going professor. The material is very dry but he tries to make it bearable. I took the summer session it was one midterm and one final both were essays. He gives the topics before the exam which allows you enough time to decide which essays to do. Overall enjoyed his class, easy compared to other profs at baruch.

comments: Highly recommended. He knows his stuff and seems to stay current on it too. He has a good sense of humor and makes class interesting. You can study off the powerpoints and get a good grade. He drops the lowest exam grade.

school_name: New York City College of Technology
tag_professor: Respected (2)  Hilarious (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)  Caring (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  Amazing lectures (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)
comments: Really nice professor, give you review for the exams. Give two exams and a final. for the two test he drop the lowest. 80% of the grade is on the exams. Rest of the grade is on projects, two projects 10% each. really great professor. Crack a joke once a while, old guy nice guy.

school_name: New York City College of Technology
tag_professor: Respected (2)  Hilarious (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)  Caring (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  Amazing lectures (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)
comments: Scanlon is a very good professor. He gives you all of the information you need to know in class, but that doesn\'t mean you shouldn\'t read the text. Sometimes, he\'ll ask questions about the readings in the middle of class and if no one knows the answer, he gets annoyed. He is also a little sarcastic, and I like that, but I don\'t know if others would

school_name: New York City College of Technology
tag_professor: Respected (2)  Hilarious (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)  Caring (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  Amazing lectures (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)
comments: He is the best to teach Psycho! Very clear, he teach with a lot examples that allows you to understand perfectly. He is very smart and funny. You can see that he has passion to teach and knows the material well. Just go regularly to class and read the book. Easy "A"

school_name: New York City College of Technology
tag_professor: Respected (2)  Hilarious (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)  Caring (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  Amazing lectures (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)
comments: I took him for child psych. Let me cut to the chase, Go to class everyday and don\'t leave early. STUDY the Textbook inside and Out. The lectures are helpful but you will get bored very easily, they are mandatory so just go. Look he drops 1 exam and the rest of the exams are so freakin easy. Just study the book. Easy A. Also.. the final is a joke.

school_name: New York City College of Technology

comments: He is a good professor! u can study a week before every exam n get good grades...Read da book once in a while. His Final exam is da key, gives da same questions from da previous exams given in class. U should score 100% in da final n get your grade up.

school_name: New York City College of Technology

comments: Prof goes out of his way to help students do well. His lectures are great and he uses powerpoint. The only catch is that you actually need to study! But, really, if you put just a little elbow grease in, you can do well.
